## DurableOperation.waitForData() method

Wait for data for the current operation. If data is not found by the time the execution completes, this function will throw an error.

**Signature:**

```typescript
waitForData(status?: WaitingOperationStatus): Promise<DurableOperation<TResult>>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter

</th><th>

Type

</th><th>

Description

</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

status

</td><td>

[WaitingOperationStatus](./durable-execution-sdk-js-testing.waitingoperationstatus.md)

</td><td>

_(Optional)_ The operation status to wait for. Default value is STARTED

</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

Promise&lt;[DurableOperation](./durable-execution-sdk-js-testing.durableoperation.md)<!-- -->&lt;TResult&gt;&gt;

A promise that resolves to this OperationWithData instance once the specified status is reached

## Exceptions

Will throw an error if data is not available when the execution completes

## Example 1

```typescript
const wait = runner.getOperation("my-wait");
const myWait = await wait.waitForData();
assert(myWait.getWaitDetails()?.waitSeconds === 10);
```

## Example 2

```typescript
const callback = runner.getOperation("my-callback");
const myCallback = await callback.waitForData(WaitingOperationStatus.SUBMITTED);
myCallback.sendCallbackSuccess("Hello World");
```
